comment.author: 72133717@N05
comment._content: According to the 1911 Census Alexander Seggie was born in Dublin in 1893. In 1911 he was living at 28 Princes Street, Tonbridge Wells, Kent with his mother and father Janet & William and a younger brother Thomas.

comment.author: 69679868@N03
comment._content: Alexander Seggie was commissioned in May 1915 as a Second Lieutenant on Probation [Supplement to London Gazette of 14 May 1915] and posted to the Depot and 3rd Battalion Royal Irish Fusiliers then at Buncrana. He was appointed to an Active Service appointment with the Royal Irish Fusiliers with 8 other Second Lieutenants with effect 20 Jan 1916. A full account of the attack by 9th Royal Irish Fusiliers on 1st July 1916 may be found at www.webmatters.net/txtpat/index.php?id=77 Suffice to say that 9 RIF went over the top of their parapet in four waves between 07.10hrs and 07.30hrs to get into a feature in no-mans-land called the Ravine, within 150 yards of the German line, before the artillery lifted at 07.30hrs (Zero). However the German machine-gunners had located the gaps cut in the wire through which the Fusiliers had to approach their objectives. Of 33 officers and just over 600 other ranks of 9 RIF who attacked, 215 All Ranks were Killed or posted Missing and 303 were Wounded. 2Lt Alexander Seggie was one of the Missing - his remains were only later recovered from the battlefield.//

comment.author: 64288588@N05
comment._content: His birth was registered in Dublin North in the Jul-Sep Quarter of 1892.
